DialogueOption.Text: Hey, Mica. Got any questions about the universe for me?
I figured out what causes sand to flow between the Hourglass Twins!

Dialogue.Page: Wha? Are you still half-awake from your nap, astronaut? You musta had some crazy dreams!
Eh, whatever. Let's hear your ideas for what causes the twins' weird shifting sands, astronaut!

DialogueOption.Text: Chert says it's just some sort of natural phenomenon.
It's caused by gravity from the sun and the twin closer to the sun combining during alignment.

Dialogue.Page: Pfff. I've heard that before too, astronaut!
Slate says that's just Chert's fancy way of saying they don't know what causes it.
I'd never say that to Chert's face.. but I feel like there's gotta just be more we haven't figured out there!
Huh.. So it's gravity from the sun... and gravity from the twin closer to the sun combining, that causes sand to flow between the twins...
Huh.. That makes sense! The sun's gotta have some insane gravitational pull, after all.
But I can't just take what you tell me at face value! We gotta test it out!
Umm.. I guess the only way we'll only know if your theory's true, is if sand stops flowing between the Twins once they orbit out of alignment, huh?
That's gonna take a while.. But wow, I can't wait to test your theory out, astronaut!
Questions about the universe? Uh, wow, you're putting me on the spot, astronaut! Uhh, lemme think a sec...
How about.. No, I figured that one out... Um, what about... Oh, OH! I got one!
Ahem... Why does sand stop flowing between the Hourglass Twins, astronaut?

DialogueOption.Text: Wait.. Sand stops flowing between the Hourglass Twins?
Oh, it's just the sun and the twin closer to the sun falling out of alignment.

Dialogue.Page: Yeah, haven't you noticed? Sand hasn't been flowing between the Hourglass Twins for some time now.
When sand isn't flowing between them, the "Hourglass Twins" don't really live up to their name, do they? They should just be called "The Twins", haha!
Oh well. At least we know the sand starts flowing between the Twins again real soon!
Chert told me that when the sun rises over the horizon on the morning of your launch day, sand would start flowing between the Hourglass Twins again.
Isn't that lucky, astronaut? It feels like a good omen for your launch!
I dunno how Chert knows exactly when sand flows between the Hourglass Twins, but as long as it's coming back soon, I'm happy!

DialogueOption.Text: Maybe I'll go ask Chert what they know, then.

Dialogue.Page: Sounds like a plan!
If you learn anything about the sand column, could ya come back and tell me all about it too?
It probably wouldn't be useful knowledge to anyone... But it'd mean the world to me finally solve this weird little mystery!
